citeinfo.origin: Asia Pacific Spatial Data Project (APSDP), formerly ACASIAN or Australian Centre of the Asian Spatial Information and Analysis Network
citeinfo.title: Major Roads - North Korea

descript.abstract: A polyline coverage which represents road transportation routes throughout North Korea. Roads included in this coverage are identified as Motorways, Major Highways, and Minor Highways.Highway arcs usually do not intersect Motorway arcs, and point locations in the North Korean administrative point coverages are not snapped to them. The point locations for such settlements have been snapped to highway arcs unless map sources show them to be located more than a kilometer or so from the highways.
descript.purpose: This transportation data layer documents the Motorway, Major Highway, and Minor Highway routes that provide the infrastructure for urban and rural development throughout North Korea. Applications, such as the exploration of the development of transportation routes and networks and its correlation to key urban growth processes, will be of use to urban and regional planners, policy and decision-makers, earth scientists, and global change researchers. These data are intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and to provide users with geographic data for cartographic, environmental monitoring, management and impact analysis, economic analysis and other types of geographic analysis. These data can be used with geographic information systems (GIS) software to display and analyze information on transportation and associated areas of interest, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.
descript.supplinf: Data originally supplied in ARC/INFO 7.2 export format (.e00), and are projected in decimal degrees using the WGS84 Spheroid/Datum.

idinfo.accconst: Access is granted to licensee (Harvard University) only.

cntaddr.address: School of International Business & Asian Studies

idinfo.datacred: Spatial data produced at the Asia Pacific Spatial Data Project (formerly known as the Australian Centre of the Asian Spatial Information and Analysis Network, ACASIAN) under the direction of Lawrence W. Crissman. Copyright Griffith University.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows NT Version 4.0 (Build 1381) Service Pack 6; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.2.0.700

attracc.attraccr: The names of populated places, administrative regions, railroad stations, and others are provided in Hangul (Korean syllabary), Unofficial romanization, Official romanization and in the Yale romanization system in their respective attribute tables.

procstep.procdesc: The original shape file was imported to an ArcSDE Layer.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypd: ESRI Shapefile. Lines represent major roads

Internal node number for the end of an arc (to-node).
Internal node number for the left polygon.
Internal node number for the right polygon.
Internally calculated length of feature in map units.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Internally calculated length of feature in map units.
